creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: green bamboo trees in foreground growing from ground covered with grey pebbles; larger rocks and a stone walking path along with colorful bushes and dense foliage in middle and background; top of a white building to L in front of blue, pink, and green tinted mountains
inscription: Left: [一九五四年作　箱根神仙郷　竹の苧お庭] {1954nen saku, Hakone Shinsenkyō, take no oniwa}; bottom, in grey: [Bamboo Garden, Hakone Museum], in pencil: [Toshi Yoshida]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Bamboo Garden, Hakone Museum
